transcript.text: Shalom everybody I'm sure some of you
probably thought I wasn't gonna do a
Sabbath hike today but in fact our
prayer meeting just ended and it's been
raining all day today I thought I was
gonna be hiking in the rain but it sort
of led up at this point but the Sun sets
very late here in Alaska during this
time of year in fact it's it's just
about just past 6 o'clock right now and
we still got about 4 hours left of
daylight so probably doing my Sabbath
hikes sort of later on Sabbath during
the summer time but I wanted to show
this part because it's just that I've
been looking at the mist on the
mountains all day on my window and I
wanted to share it with everybody here
one of my favorite favorite parts of
living in Alaska is just seeing the
beautiful mist on the mountains it's
just so gorgeous and this happens not
only in the winter but also all for the
summer as well which I love I love
cloudy weather I mean I love Sun and
blue skies but I love love-love-love
cloudy weather and we get that most of
the time here in Juneau it's one of the
again one of the reasons I love living
here
hallelujah so if you are new to my
channel but this is my Sabbath hike that
I put up every Sabbath day Saturday
sometimes in the day I go out I have a
nice little Shabbat hike hallelujah and
just show and share the wonders of
Alaska
such a beautiful summer day it's about
in the mid mid 50s today which is a
typical summer day here in Juneau
actually 55 60 degrees was a typical
summer day another reason I love living
here
I love of love the cool summers I love
how I never have to use an
air-conditioned don't even need a window
unit like I used to have to use in
Portland when I live in Oregon I don't
even need that look at that sounds just
coming out now for the clouds that's
just beautiful
[Applause]
and as you can see everything is just
completely green now so there's a period
of months in the late winter early
spring after the snow has melted or
everything's brown because it you know
we haven't had a lot of sunlight we
don't get a lot of sunlight in the fall
in the winter but by this point in June
everything's green and all that rain and
snow that we've gone throughout the year
it's paid off
obviously this living here is not for
everyone especially if you do not like
cold or cooler weather but I always joke
on like a polar bear and so beautiful
and said this weather is for me the feet
of him who brings good bouncing peace
proclaiming news of happiness
[Music]
[Applause]
no news talk on these videos no
reporting no interviews just walking
singing and sharing the beauty of Juneau
Alaska
[Applause]
and by the way if you're new to keeping
the Sabbath day one of the greatest
activities that you can do on the
Sabbath is to go out and hike and admire
the oz creation oh my goodness you can't
really see it but there's a rainbow you
can kind of see you can kind of see it
there it's really there goes across the
whole whole sky but my camera doesn't
really pick up the the rest of it
unfortunately let me see if I it's like
yeah I just showed me the perfect time
to come out here and do my Sabbath Oh
[Laughter]
hallelujah
[Applause]
shabbat shalom everybody
shabbat shalom
